title: Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set

fields.label: Is this clinical specialization part of the UAMS Health extension to the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_query
fields.instructions: Answer "Yes" if this is a clinical specialization that is not a part of the core Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set found at https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

fields.label: Qualifications for Inclusion in the UAMS Health Extension to the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
Applies Nationally
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_national_query
fields.instructions: The clinical specialization applies at a national level and is not restricted to local use.

fields.label: Unique Need
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_unique_query
fields.instructions: The clinical specialization meets a unique need that is well-defined and separate and distinct from other clinical specializations currently in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set.

fields.label: Organizational Unit Supports the Addition
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_org_query
fields.instructions: The addition of the specialization has the support of the related UAMS organizational unit(s), if applicable.

fields.label: Provider Type
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_provider_type
fields.instructions: Identify the type of provider impacted by this new clinical specialization.

choices.md-do: Medical doctors (M.D.) or doctors of osteopathy (D.O.)

fields.label: Recognizing Authority
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_authority

choices.board-certification-abms: The area of specialty is recognized for certification by the American Board of Medical Specialties.
choices.board-certification-aoa: The area of specialty is recognized for certification by the American Osteopathic Association certifying boards or conjoint examination committees.
choices.training-program-acgme: There is an accredited residency/fellowship specialty/subspecialty training program by the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education.
choices.training-program-aoa: There is an accredited residency/fellowship specialty/subspecialty training program by AOA-accredited Osteopathic Graduate Medical Education.

fields.label: Specialty Certificate or Subspecialty Certificate
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_certificate
fields.instructions: Select the specialty certificate or subspecialty certificate from the relevant certifying board or examination committee recognizing the area of specialty.

fields.label: Training Type
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_type
fields.instructions: Identify the type of training program.

fields.label: The training requirements demonstrate that the provider has a recognized area of specialty / subspecialty that is separate and distinct from others.
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_distinct_query

fields.label: Training Level
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_level
fields.instructions: Identify the specificity of the training program.

fields.label: Name of the Training Program's Specialty
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_specialty
fields.instructions: For the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education, this information can be found at https://www.acgme.org/specialties/.

fields.label: Name of the Training Program's Subspecialty
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_subspecialty
fields.instructions: For the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education, this information can be found in the specialty sections linked at https://www.acgme.org/specialties/.

fields.label: Official Webpage Concerning the Training Program's Specialty/Subspecialty
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_url

fields.label: The training program is accredited by a third party.
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_accreditation_query

fields.label: Name of the Third Party Accrediting Organization
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_accreditation_org

fields.label: Official Website of the Third Party Accrediting Organization
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_accreditation_org_url

fields.label: The third party accrediting organization establishes training program requirements, conducts periodic reviews of the programs, and has the authority to sanction programs.
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_accrediting_authority_query

fields.label: A certification examination is required for graduates of the specialty / subspecialty training program to earn the designation.
fields.name: clinical_specialization_extension_examination_query

fields.label: Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
Field Values for UAMS Health Extension to the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
fields.message: Enter the values in the fields below as if this clinical specialization was part of the core code set.

fields.label: Does this specialization have a taxonomy code in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_code_query

fields.label: Specialization Taxonomy Code in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
fields.name: clinical_specialization_code
fields.instructions:
This information can be found in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set at https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

Example: "207LA0401X".

fields.label: Specialization Name in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
fields.name: clinical_specialty_name
fields.instructions:
This information can be found in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set at https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

Example: "Addiction Medicine" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X.

fields.label: Specialization Display Name in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
fields.name: clinical_specialization_name_display
fields.instructions:
This information can be found in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set at https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

Example: "Addiction Medicine (Anesthesiology) Physician" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X.

fields.label: Is this clinical specialization a valid selection?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_valid
fields.instructions: Some taxonomy codes are strictly grouping codes for taxonomy codes within their group, and are not to be used as a taxonomy code (e.g., Pathology [207Z00000X]). One of the other codes within their group that describes provider practice, training and certification must be used instead.

fields.label: Clinical Occupation Title Based on the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
fields.name: clinical_specialization_title
fields.instructions:
Determine the patient-facing clinical occupation title to be used for this specialization based on its name, context and description in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set; the word choices used by the certifying organization; and standard nomenclature.

Example: "Addiction Medicine Anesthesiologist" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X.

fields.label: Alternate Names for the Clinical Occupation Title
fields.name: clinical_specialization_title_alt

fields.label: Specialization Definition in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
fields.name: clinical_specialization_definition
fields.placeholder: e.g., An anesthesiologist who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of addictions.

fields.label: Source of Specialization Definition in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
fields.name: clinical_specialization_definition_source

fields.label: Related CMS Specialty Code
How to Find the CMS Specialty Code
fields.message:
The official list of specialty codes can be found in Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services Publication 100-06: Medicare Financial Management Manual; Chapter 6: Medicare Administrator Contractor (MAC) Financial Reports; Section 400.3: Specialty Codes.

Find which CMS specialty code is paired with each taxonomy code at Data.CMS.gov in the Medicare Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk.

It can also be found on NPIdb.org on each taxonomy code page (e.g., https://npidb.org/taxonomy/207LA0401X/).

fields.label: Inherit the related CMS Specialty Code and Provider/Supplier Type from the parent?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_cms_code_inherit_query
fields.instructions: Note that changing the relevant value in the parent term will not automatically update this term. After any change to the relevant value in the parent term this term will need to be updated by simply opening the term and clicking "Update."

fields.label: Does a CMS Specialty Code exist for this clinical specialization?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_cms_code_query

fields.label: Related CMS Specialty Code
fields.name: clinical_specialization_cms_code
fields.instructions: Example: "79" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X.

fields.label: Related CMS Provider/Supplier Type
fields.name: clinical_specialization_cms_code_type
fields.instructions:
Include "Physician/" at the beginning if the specialty code is in the list of Physician/Limited License Physician Specialty Codes.

Examples: "Physician/Addiction Medicine" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X, "Certified Nurse Midwife" for taxonomy code 367A00000X.

fields.label: Related Schema.org MedicalSpecialty
About the Schema.org MedicalSpecialty Enumeration Type
fields.message: The Schema.org MedicalSpecialty enumeration type is a limited set of possible values for the specific branch of medical science or practice. The enumeration members include clinical specialties that pertain to particular organ systems and their respective disease states, as well as allied health specialties

fields.label: Inherit the related Schema.org MedicalSpecialty enumeration member from the parent?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_medicalspecialty_member_inherit_query
fields.instructions: Note that changing the relevant value in the parent term will not automatically update this term. After any change to the relevant value in the parent term this term will need to be updated by simply opening the term and clicking "Update."

fields.label: MedicalSpecialty Enumeration Member
fields.name: clinical_specialization_medicalspecialty_member

fields.label: Related O*Net-SOC Occupation Code
About O*Net-SOC
fields.message:
The Occupational Information Network — or O*NET — is a free online database that contains hundreds of job definitions to help students, job seekers, businesses and workforce development professionals to understand today's world of work in the United States.

O*NET classifies jobs in job families (functional areas which include workers from entry level to advanced, and may include several sub-specialties).

All O*NET occupations conform to the Standard Occupational Classification — or SOC — the United States government system of classifying occupations.

fields.label: How to Find the O*Net-SOC Occupation Code
Inherit the related O*Net-SOC Occupation Code and Occupation Name from the parent?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_onetsoc_code_inherit_query
fields.instructions: Note that changing the relevant value in the parent term will not automatically update this term. After any change to the relevant value in the parent term this term will need to be updated by simply opening the term and clicking "Update."

fields.label: Does an O*Net-SOC Occupation Code exist for this clinical specialization?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_onetsoc_code_query

fields.label: Related O*Net-SOC Occupation Code
fields.name: clinical_specialization_onetsoc_code
fields.instructions: Example: "29-1211.00" — the code for Anesthesiologists — for taxonomy code 207LA0401X (Addiction Medicine [Anesthesiology] Physician).

fields.label: Related O*Net-SOC Occupation Name
fields.name: clinical_specialization_onetsoc_code_name
fields.instructions: Example: "Anesthesiologists" — the name associated with the code 29-1211.00 — for taxonomy code 207LA0401X (Addiction Medicine [Anesthesiology] Physician).

fields.label: Related ISCO-08 Code
About ISCO-08
fields.message: The International Standard Classification of Occupations — or ISCO — is an International Labour Organization classification structure for organizing information on labour and jobs. It is part of the international family of economic and social classifications of the United Nations. The current version is known as ISCO-08.

fields.label: Information About Each ISCO-08 Code
fields.message: For descriptions and examples of each occupation, see pages 82-108 of "ISCO-08 Part 3: Definitions of Major Groups, Sub-Major Groups, Minor Groups and Unit Groups" at https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/docs/groupdefn08.pdf (archived at https://archive.is/TTr4R).

fields.label: Inherit the related ISCO-08 Code from the parent?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_isco08_code_inherit_query
fields.instructions: Note that changing the relevant value in the parent term will not automatically update this term. After any change to the relevant value in the parent term this term will need to be updated by simply opening the term and clicking "Update."

fields.label: Does an ISCO-08 Code exist for this clinical specialization?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_isco08_code_query

fields.label: ISCO-08 Code
fields.name: clinical_specialization_isco08_code

choices.2263: Environmental and Occupational Health and Hygiene Professionals (2263)

Inherit the reference webpages about the occupation from the parent?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_sameas_occupation_inherit_query
fields.instructions: Note that changing the relevant value in the parent term will not automatically update this term. After any change to the relevant value in the parent term this term will need to be updated by simply opening the term and clicking "Update."

fields.label: Reference Webpages About the Occupation
fields.name: clinical_specialization_sameas_occupation

fields.label: Inherit the reference webpages about the specialty / field from the parent?
fields.name: clinical_specialization_sameas_field_inherit_query
fields.instructions: Note that changing the relevant value in the parent term will not automatically update this term. After any change to the relevant value in the parent term this term will need to be updated by simply opening the term and clicking "Update."

fields.label: Reference Webpages About the Specialty / Field
fields.name: clinical_specialization_sameas_field
fields.instructions: The field is often linked from a section titled "field of this occupation" on the Wikidata item page for the occupation.
